required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Daily Physical Activity in Children and Adolescents With Low Lumbar and Sacral Level Myelomeningocele

brief_summary.textblock: Obesity is getting more common and challenging to treat in children and adolescents with myelomeningocele. Therefore, it is becoming more important to determine daily physical activity in these patients. Daily walking performance and average steps per day in patients with low lumbar and sacral level myelomeningocele are shown to not differ from healthy controls. Step counts can not reflect all torsional accelerations associated with daily living activities. Omnidirectional accelerometers provide all types of body movement outputs and give detailed parameters of physical activity level and energy expenditure. There is no data about energy expenditure and physical activity level of the patients with myelomeningocele in daily routine. This study aims to quantify energy expenditure and physical activity of children and adolescents with low lumbar and sacral level myelomeningocele.

detailed_description.textblock: Children and adolescents with low lumbar and sacral level myelomeningocele, and age-, sex-, and BMI-matched controls were included. Omnidirectional accelerometer monitor (Actical®) was used to assess activity energy expenditure and daily durations spent in sedentary, light activity and moderate to vigorous physical activity (MVPA).

primary_outcome.time_frame: After wearing monitors for five consecutive days
primary_outcome.description: Activity energy expenditure (AEE) (kcal/kg/min) refers to thermogenesis from all activities associated with daily living. An average amount of three valid weekdays will be calculated.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After wearing monitors for five consecutive days
secondary_outcome.description: The sedentary level (min) is the total amount of time when AEE below 0.01 kcal/kg/min. The light level is the total amount of time when AEE between 0.01 and 0.04 kcal/kg/min. The moderate level is the total amount of time when AEE between 0.04 and 0.10 kcal/kg/min. The vigorous level (min) is the total amount of time when AEE above 0.10 kcal/kg/min.

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed myelomeningocele with the neurological level between L5 and S3
age-, sex-, and body mass index-matched healthy controls

intervention.intervention_name: Omnidirectional accelerometer monitor (3x3 cm and 16 g, Actical®, Philips Respironics)
intervention.description: All participants were instructed to wear monitors for five consecutive days except during water-based activities. Data for each participant was collected to ensure included three valid weekdays. Daily activity energy expenditure (kcal/kg/min), and sedentary, light, moderate and vigorous levels (min) were examined using a software program.

study_pop.textblock: Children and adolescents with low lumbar and sacral level myelomeningocele and their age-, sex-, and body mass index (BMI)-matched healthy peers were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients diagnosed myelomeningocele with the neurological level between L5 and S3
- Patients aged between 6 and 16 years
- Independent ambulatory patients without an assistive device or braces
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of disorders other than myelomeningocele that affect physical activity or exercise (e.g. rheumatic disease, cardiovascular disease)
- Unable to wear omnidirectional accelerometer monitor (Actical®, Philips Respironics) for five consecutive days
